content.description: Sit start with a left hand-heel match, slap up on either side of the block. Not super hard, but a little bit of burl and sloper action. The blocks on the right are off.
content.location: In the downstream clearing side of the boulder cluster. Faces downhill. Look for the short face.

content.description: Sit start with a fist jam, clamber on top of the block on the left. I don't know why anyone would climb this. I don't know whyÂ I climbed it. It was there, I guess. Maybe could be more fun to skip the handjam and try to compress up the middle.
content.location: The uphill-facing side of the main outcropping of the Mossman boulders.

content.description: Sit start under the small prow with high crystals on either side. Work up, top out on the left face. Most of the difficulty comes near the start.
content.location: In the clearing on the downstream side of the boulder cluster, head uphill a ways and the boulder should be on your right.

content.description: Climb the easy slab. Trend left and top out at the peak rather than earlier on the right for a bit more fun.
content.protection: Pad. Bit of an awkward fall zone.
content.location: The low-angle slab just above the main outcrop of boulders. Faces towards the stream.

content.description: Sit start with wide hands. Move up and right, using the cool big pocket.
content.location: On the upstream-facing side of the Mossman area. Look for the big pocket.

content.description: Sit start with a high right hand and a left wherever it's useful. Crux start to an easy finish. Block on the right is off. See the comments for more beta.
content.location: On the downstream side of the Mossman boulders, near the top of the clearing. Just uphill from Slap Chop.

content.description: The cluster of boulders just past the Wereslab along the trail. The bulk of the problems here are easy or at most moderate. Most are sit-starts, most are at least a little awkward or dirty (or both), but there's some fun moves worth doing.
